name: Mirror Master Data
description: Module migrates the intersect of fields found in parent and child project

project-settings.name:
Instructions

This rather complex module copies data from a source project to a child project in response to a logical condition. The child project could be in another arm of the main project or an entirely different REDCap project.

A common use of this module is to take screening data in one project and migrate to an official study project after vetting for eligibility and/or consent.

You can set up multiple migrations from a single master project (such as having many sub-studies off of a master participant list)
List of Child Projects to receive Mirrored Data

sub_settings.name:
MASTER EVENT
If longitudinal, enter the event where source data resides.
All data must be in one event, including the triggering form

TRIGGER LOGIC
Only clone from MASTER if this logical expression is true (leave blank to always clone)

TRIGGERING FORM
The logic above will only be evaluated when this form is saved. If left blank, logic is applied after all saves (less efficient)

SELECT CHILD PROJECT
You must have access to the project to select it below

CHILD EVENT NAME
If child project is classical, leave blank, otherwise specify child event where data will go. (e.g. event_1_arm_1)
DAG Configuration
Check this option if DAGs names are the same between Master and Child projects.
If DAGs names are different between master and child projects please specify the DAGs name
Select Master DAG
Type Child DAG

SELECT FIELD COPY OPTIONS
Fields in both the parent project and the target project have to have the same fieldnames (and same choices if radio/dropdown/checkbox)

choices.name: Migrate a specified list of fieldnames

sub_settings.name:
INCLUDED FIELD LIST
List of fields to include - must be present in both projects.

CHILD FORM ONLY
Migrate only the fields on this form.

PARENT FORM ONLY
Migrate only fields from this PARENT form.

EXCLUDED FIELD LIST
Remove these fields from the list generated above so they are not copied to the child project

CHILD RECORD NAMING OPTIONS
Select how to determine the child project record id.

choices.name: 1. AUTO-INCREMENT CHILD ID
2. USE SAME ID as PARENT
3. USE FIELD VALUE FROM PARENT

sub_settings.name:
1. AUTO-INCREMENT CHILD ID OPTION
Add PREFIX to new CHILD ID
You can use specific words (e.g. STAN-). Or you can append DAG name or ID (e.g. [DAG:NAME]-, [DAG:ID]-). Leave blank for no prefix

1. AUTO-INCREMENT CHILD ID OPTION
Pad the new CHILD ID
If specified, it will pad the numerical portion of the record ID to the specified number of digits. For example, a padding of '4' will result in an id:STAN-0004 with a prefix of STAN-

3. USE FIELD VALUE FROM PARENT OPTION
Specify field in parent project to use as child record ID.
Use this option if you need to manually specify your child record ID.
If this field has no value in the source record, there will be no migration.
If two records share the same value or Clobber existing data is used, you could overwrite the child data

LOG CHILD RECORD ID IN PARENT FIELD
If specified, the child's ID will be saved in this parent field

LOG PARENT RECORD ID IN CHILD PROJECT
If specified, the parent record's ID will be saved in this child field

REDO/CLOBBER MIGRATION
If checked, migration will be repeated on each parent save.

This can result in multiple records being created if New ID creation is set or existing data in the child project to be overwritten if TARGET ID is reused.

MIGRATION TIMESTAMP FIELD
This required field in the parent project stores the timestamp when migration was completed.
Migration only takes place when this field is empty unless Clobber existing data is checked.

MIGRATION NOTES
(optional) Upon completion of migration, notes will be logged in this parent field.
